title: Moon ice in the Artemis era: what we still don’t know
summary: While NASA has long hoped for extractable water ice on the lunar surface, making use of the resource may be harder than expected.

title: NASA extends Starliner stay at ISS for additional testing
summary: NASA and Boeing will keep the CST-100 Starliner spacecraft at the International Space Station for at least four more days to perform additional testing of the commercial crew vehicle before it returns to Earth.

title: An Obscure Anniversary of July 4, 1776
summary: As of June 14, 2024, exactly one year has passed on Pluto since the signing of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776.

title: Kayhan Space Satcat platform merges space data
summary: Kayhan Space unveiled Satcat, a new source for information on objects and events in Earth orbit.

title: Voyager 1 returning science data again
summary: The four instruments on NASA’s Voyager 1 spacecraft are returning science data for the first time since a computer malfunction last November, as scientists hope to keep the mission operating for up to another decade.

title: Blue Origin, SpaceX, ULA to compete for $5.6 billion in Pentagon launch contracts
summary: Blue Origin scores first major national security launch deal

title: SIA reports more record growth for the global commercial satellite industry
summary: Global satellite industry revenue climbed 2% year-on-year to $285 billion for 2023, according to the Satellite Industry Association’s 27th annual space economy snapshot released June 13.

title: Bezos’ Blue Origin joins SpaceX, ULA in winning bids for $5.6 billion Pentagon rocket program
summary: The Pentagon announced the first winning bidders in its rocket launch contract sweepstakes on Thursday, with Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin grabbing a spot for the first time.

title: House Appropriations Committee pares back Space Force budget request
summary: The committee cut $900 million from the Space Force’s proposed $29.6 billion budget

title: U.S. to rely on commercial satellites to image spacecraft in orbit
summary: The National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency is interested in “commercial unclassified non-Earth imaging and associated analytics"
